questions.question: Chronic Adaptations are

choices.answer: Changes to the Cardio Vascular, Respiratory, Muscular

questions.question: One chronic adaptation as a result of aerobic training to the muscular system is

choices.answer: Increase in the size and number of Mitochondria
Decrease in the size of Slow Twitch Fibres
Increase in the number of fast twitch fibres

questions.question: Factors that result in an increase in Stroke Volume include

choices.answer: decreased heart rate, decreased Cardiac Output
Increased left ventricle volume,increased arterial stiffness
Increased left ventricle volume, increased filling time
Increased heart rate, increased systolic blood pressure

questions.question: Which of the following contributes to an increase in arterio-venous difference

choices.answer: Decreased size of slow twitch fibres
Increased capacity of the Respiratory System
Increased capillarisation at the muscle fibre

questions.question: The function of the mitochondria is to

choices.answer: Convert oxygen and glucose to energy within the muscle cell.
Regulate the temperature of the body.
Remove Carbon Dioxide from the muscle cell

questions.question: Glycogen sparing relates to

choices.answer: Eating a diet that is high in Carbohydrates
Increased oxidation of glycogen at submaximal intensities
Eating a diet that is low in Carbohydrates
Increased oxidation of fats at submaximal intensities

questions.question: Chronic adaptations to Anaerobic training mainly occur within the
The myocardium is

choices.answer: Responsible for the breakdown of glucose in the muscle
The proper name for the oxidation of fats

questions.question: The system that produces energy at the fastest rate but has a finite capacity is the
Fartlek and Continuous training are both forms of aerobic training. The main difference is

choices.answer: Frequency - Fartlek 5-7 times a week, Continuous 3-4 times
Intensity - Fartlek has periods of higher intensity
Duration - Fartlek done for 60+ min, Continuous 20+ minutes
Specificity - Fartlek specific to running only.

choices.answer: increased recruitment of fast twitch fibres
increased oxidation of fats at sub max intensities
increased oxidation of glycogen at sub max intensities

questions.question: Stroke Volume and Heart Rate both increase during exercise. This results in

choices.answer: a decrease in blood flow to working muscles
